thread.title: Judy MacLeod becomes first female commissioner of FBS conference
thread.title_full: Judy MacLeod becomes first female commissioner of FBS conference - San Antonio Express-News

author: Nick Moyle
title: Judy MacLeod becomes first female commissioner of FBS conference
text:
Conference USA announced Executive Associate Commissioner and Chief Operating Officer Judy MacLeod will become the league's new commissioner in a press release Monday.
MacLeod will become C-USA's third commissioner. Britton Banowsky, who resigned in July to take a position as Executive Director of the College Football Playoff Foundation, had held the post since 2002.
"I feel very fortunate and appreciative of the confidence our member schools have placed in me to lead and serve the great group of universities in Conference USA," MacLeod said. "We have a tremendous opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our student-athletes, and I look forward to facing the challenges and opportunities together with our members."
MacLeod, who had been serving in an interim capacity following Banowsky's departure, will become the first female commissioner of an FBS conference.
Her selection was by unanimous decision.
nmoyle@express-news.net
Twitter: @NRMoyle
Judy MacLeod named the third C-USA Commissioner; first female FBS leader! pic.twitter.com/xfnjTmSG7T
